definition: to eat one's fill/to be full
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
to stop/to pause/to arrange/to lay out/to kowtow/to stamp (one's foot)/at once/classifier for meals, beatings, scoldings etc: time, bout, spell, meal

sentences.english: He washed himself, and ate a hearty meal .
sentences.chinese: 他洗了一把臉，然後飽餐一頓。

sentences.english: Have you watched a cat who is trying to catch something tasty for dinner?
sentences.chinese: 觀察過貓抓獵物以飽餐一頓嗎？

sentences.english: the boa constrictor, when he has had an adequate meal , goes to sleep, and does not wake until he needs another meal.
sentences.chinese: 巨蟒飽餐一頓後就睡覺，直到需要再喫一頓時才醒來。

sentences.english: We ate to our heart ' s content at her home last Sunday .
sentences.chinese: 我們上星期天在她家飽餐一頓。

sentences.english: Eg . There was a time when we could get a good meal for less than 1 yuan.
sentences.chinese: 曾經有個時候我們不用花1元錢就能飽餐一頓。

sentences.english: But she will return to feast upon the trophy at her leisure.
sentences.chinese: 等空閒時它會回來飽餐一頓。

sentences.english: Grab a piece of your favorite meal and stay quiet after that?
sentences.chinese: 抓起你最喜愛的美食飽餐一頓，然後靜靜地呆在那裏？

sentences.english: He has been repeatedly jailed and then released, each time going immediately to a restaurant and ordering lavishly.
sentences.chinese: 約翰遜幾度進宮，每次釋放都要立即去飯店飽餐一頓。

sentences.english: Graba piece of your favorite meal and stay quiet after that?
sentences.chinese: 抓起你最喜愛的美食飽餐一頓，然後靜靜地呆在那裏？

sentences.english: They're here to feed on a glut of newly hatched cadis flies.
sentences.chinese: 剛孵出的石蠶蛾吸引它們到這裏飽餐一頓。

sentences.english: He would make a feast of the portly grunter.
After I ate that heavy meal, I became very sleepy.
sentences.chinese: 飽餐一頓之後，我就很困了。

definition: to buy on a considerable scale/to purchase/to procure/to stock up
hot pot containing stinky tofu and other ingredients (Taiwanese dish)
Yancheng district of Kaohsiung city 高雄市[Gao1 xiong2 shi4], south Taiwan
to go sightseeing/to spend one's leisure time wandering around
produce/fresh fruits and vegetables/fresh aquatic food/fresh herbs
(Tw) (slang) to pass time idly/to chill/to hang out
